intro: Stachys hirsuta, commonly known as hairy betony, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces spikes of purple or pink flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Stachys hirsuta is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional herbal medicine.
